explanation: The report is correct. MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.2 requires that a for loop have a single loop counter that is initialized in the first clause, tested in the second clause (with no persistent side effects), and modified only in the third clause; the loop counter must not be modified in the loop body. In the shown code the loop header uses i as the loop counter (for (i = 0; i < len; ++i)), but the loop body also modifies i (e.g. the expression if (++i < len) and the ++i in the else branch). Those increments are persistent side effects on the loop counter inside the loop body, so the for loop is not well-formed per Rule 14.2. (The second clause itself has no side effects, so the violation arises from modifications of i inside the loop body.)
